name: Not Fruit Ninja
tagline: For CPS841 - Introduction to Virtual Reality at Ryerson University's Department of Computer Science
body:
## Project Abstract
Players use the PSMove wand to swing at incoming objects.  Any object that comes into contact with the user's weapon will be cut, and the user will gain a point.  They must score as many points within a limited time period over the course of a few rounds.  Aside from the PSMove, this project also utilizes the Oculus Rift headset.

## Authors
This project was created by Ryan Tsao and Matthew Tesfaldet.

## Other Credit
The following people's/groups' resources were used to complete this project:
* Synty Studios for most of the assets.  Check out their stuff on their [Unity store page](syntystudios.com).
* Unity user shallway for the weapon trail effect.  Their [regular website](shallway.net) seems to be offline, so check out their [Unity store page](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/search/page=1/sortby=popularity/query=publisher:1249).
* Unity user Webcadabra for the clock model.  Check out their [website](http://webcadabra.ru/), [Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/webcadabra2.0), [VK page](https://vk.com/webcadabra), or [Unity store page](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/search/page=1/sortby=popularity/query=publisher:9123).
* Unity's standard assets.
* HipsterSloth for PSMove API for Unity 5.  Check out his [Github page](https://github.com/HipsterSloth).
* Danni Schou for the mesh slicing algorithm.  Check out his [website](http://danni.foxesgames.com/) or his [Twitter page](https://twitter.com/DanniSchou).

## Download

## Aside
Sorry Halfbrick.  Please don't sue.
